problems.title: Minimum Operations to Reduce X to Zero
problems.description:
You are given an integer array nums and an integer x. In one operation, you can either remove the leftmost or the rightmost element from the array and subtract its value from x. Note that this modifies the array for future operations.
Return the minimum number of operations to reduce x to exactly 0. If it's impossible, return -1.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and x.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the minimum operations or -1 if impossible.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4 5
1 1 4 2

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
Remove 2 from right: x = 5-2=3, array=[1,1,4]
Remove 4 from right: x = 3-4=-1, array=[1,1]
Remove 1 from right: x = -1-1=-2, array=[1]
Remove 1 from left: x = -2-1=-3, array=[]
Better way: Remove 2 from right: x=5-2=3, array=[1,1,4]
Remove 1 from left: x=3-1=2, array=[1,4]
Remove 1 from left: x=2-1=1, array=[4]
Remove 4 from right: x=1-4=-3, array=[]
Optimal: Remove 4 from right: x=5-4=1, array=[1,1,2]
Remove 2 from right: x=1-2=-1, array=[1,1]
Remove 1 from left: x=-1-1=-2, array=[1]
Remove 1 from left: x=-2-1=-3, array=[]
Actually optimal is 2 operations: remove 1 and 4.
hintsList: Find the longest subarray whose sum equals total_sum - x, then minimum operations = n - longest_length.
Use sliding window to find the maximum length subarray with sum = total_sum - x.
